  4. Outline

    • We'll cover this
    • and this
    • and this other thing, too


    1. We'll do this first
    2. next, this
    3. and finally, this other thing, too

    Bulleted lists are exactly what you'd expect 'em to be as a web developer -- a simple <ul> with some <li>s.

    Of course, ordered lists (<ol>) are supported as well if you'd like to see numbers instead of bullets.

    To display a code snippet, wrap it in a set of <pre><code></code></pre> elements.

  7. Here's an image

    You can add an image by using the <img> element. Don't forget to add an alternate text description using the alt attribute -- your sight-impaired audience using a screen reader will appreciate it.

    I recommend using 1024x768 sized images, but talk-o-vision does its best to right-size the images.

    I recommend citing the original source of the image with a data-original attribute.
